title: Fig 2. Percentage of profiles on the four sites studied grouped by discipline.

claim: STM researchers are under-represented on Academia.edu, and over-represented on ResearchGate, ORCID, and ResearcherID.When considering the presence of researchers on the four sites studied grouped by discipline, we notice that, apart from researchers in Humanities, all disciplines were under-represented on Academia.edu, even researchers in Social Sciences (Fig 2).
title: Fig 5. Number of publications referenced by researchers on the four sites compared to the number on Scopus.
caption: M and SD: Mean and standard deviation. The numbers above, on, and below the line indicate the percentage of researchers having more, the same, or fewer publications referenced on the studied sites compared to Scopus, respectively.

claim: Furthermore, experienced researchers were over-represented on the four sites, particularly on ResearcherID (Fig 3), suggesting that they are more interested in creating profiles on AIDs and ASNs.
title: Fig 6. Number of citations per article (A) and h-index (B) for ResearchGate and ResearcherID.
caption: Values for citations per article have been rounded to the nearest integer. M and SD: Mean and standard deviation.
